subject: Communication
title: Flow State in Public Speaking
description: A short lesson to help you apply Flow State in Public Speaking.

hook.text: Some speakers hit a zone where words flow effortlessly and time seems to disappear.

buildup.text: Psychologist Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi called this 'flow' â€” total absorption in a challenging task.

discovery.text: Flow requires a balance: the challenge must match your skill level. Too easy bores; too hard panics.

twist.text: Paradoxically, preparation enables spontaneity. The more you rehearse, the freer you become on stage.

climax.text: Jazz musicians, comedians, and great speakers all describe the same phenomenon: practiced improvisation.

punchline.text: Flow isn't luck. It's preparation meeting the moment.

quiz.question: Who coined the concept of 'flow state'?
